docs.lead_paragraph: Across the country, voters in dozens of states weighed in not just on candidates but on all matter of issues large and small, more than 150 of them in all.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department’s new stance that genes should not be eligible for patents is causing consternation in the biotechnology industry.

headline.seo: Gene Patent Ruling Is Criticized by Industry
headline.main: Gene Patent Ruling Raises Questions for Industry

docs.lead_paragraph: “Bad Science” by Ben Goldacre skewers quack health claims and other deliberate deceptions perpetrated in the name of science.

headline.seo: ‘Bad Science’ by Ben Goldacre Skewers Quack Health Claims - Book Review
headline.main: Wrapped in Data and Diplomas, It’s Still Snake Oil
headline.print_headline: Wrapped in Data and Diplomas, It’s Still Snake Oil

docs.snippet: “Bad Science” by Ben Goldacre skewers quack health claims and other deliberate deceptions perpetrated in the name of science.

docs.lead_paragraph: When the Justice Department declared in a court filing late Friday that genes should not be eligible for patents because they are products of nature, Harold C. Wegner, an influential patent lawyer in Washington, did not mince words. ''Eric Holder Hijacks the Patent System, Flunks Patents 101,'' Mr. Wegner wrote in an e-mail to 1,250 people, referring to the attorney general.
docs.abstract: Justice Department declaration that genes should not be eligible for patents because they are products of nature is met with sharp reaction; decision is reversal of decades of government policy; patent lawyers, including influential Washington attorney Harold C Wegner, say position is misguided and could undermine United States global leadership in various fields; advocates for new stance say that patents on genes hinder medical progress and interfere with people's access to personal information; new policy is outlined in lawsuit challenging patents held by Myriad Genetics and the University of Utah Research Foundation on genes linked to breast and ovarian cancer; drawing; photo (M)
